body:
Thanks for posting in our issue tracker.
In order to properly assist you, we need additional information:

- When does the issue occur?
- What do you see?
- What was the expected result?
- Can you supply us with a stacktrace? (optional)
- Do you have exact code to reproduce it? Maybe a PHPUnit tests that fails? (optional)

Thanks!

_This is an automated comment, triggered by adding the label `status:need more info`._

I want to see the model labels in placeholders. For this feature I set 'fieldConfig' property in ActiveForm config. There are problem when I use widget to render field.

`<?= $form->field($model, 'name', ['inputOptions' => ['placeholder' => 'one nice placeholder']]) ?>`
Generates input with placeholder

`<?= $form->field($model, 'phone', ['inputOptions' => ['placeholder' => another placeholder']])->widget(MaskedInput::className(), ['mask' => '+7 (999) 999-99-99']) ?>`
There are no placeholder
Because MaskedInput doesn't support it. It renders mask in the placeholder instead. I don't think we can fix it.

It works great when I set widget placeholder directly:

`<?= $form->field($model, 'phone')->widget(MaskedInput::className(), ['mask' => '+7 (999) 999-99-99', 'options' => ['placeholder' => 'Your phone here']]) ?>`

The problem occurs because widget "options" not set from "inputOptions" property in "widget" function.

MaskedInput support placeholder. Mask renders only when mouse on.

The solve of this issue is in the first post.

issue.title: AR: pass input options to widget

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #16681

User case:
```
<?=
$form->field($model, 'test', ['inputOptions' => ['placeholder' => 'placeholder#1']])->widget(
    MaskedInput::className(), [
        'name' => 'phone',
        'mask' => '999-999-9999',
        'options' => ['placeholder' => 'placeholder#2']
    ]
);
?>
```
Got input with 'placeholder#2' placeholder.
```
<?=
$form->field($model, 'test', ['inputOptions' => ['placeholder' => 'placeholder#1']])->widget(
    MaskedInput::className(), [
        'name' => 'phone',
        'mask' => '999-999-9999',
    ]
);
?>
```
Got input with 'placeholder#1' placeholder.

It is very raw revision for discussion purposes only.

issue.title: #16681 cause error if the $config param not already include 'options' key

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.title: ToggleButtonGroup adds "form-control" class to the conatainer <div>

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Output ToggleButtonGroup widget without "class" in the "options"

### What's expected?

`<div id="some-id" data-toggle="buttons" class="btn-group">`

### What do you get instead?

`<div id="some-id" data-toggle="buttons" class="form-control btn-group">`

So div can be displayed with borders and overlap buttons. 

### Additional info

It works as expected on yii2-bootstrap v2.0.9 and yii2 v2.0.16
It can be solved by passing an empty "class" to the widget options
`'options' => [
  'class' => []
]`

issue.title: Fix #17241 ActiveField::widget() input options

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | 
| New feature?  | 
| Breaks BC?    | /
| Tests pass?   | 
| Fixed issues  | #17241

The issue is rooted in having several points of control over a widget's input attributes. The points of control - the ones I am aware of - are listed below in order of precedence, from lowest to highest:

1. subInputWidget::options class property default value.
2. subInputWidget::options DI container configuration.
3. ActiveField::inputOptions.
4. ActiveField::widget(,$config['options']).

The first two were used before Yii 2.0.17 and prevented from the load by #16681 and #17299 fixes.
